intro: Malvastrum antofagastanum, commonly known as the Antofagasta mallow, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Chile. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton, hibiscus, and okra. The plant is characterized by its broad, palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low precipitation. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often found in coastal and desert environments along the Pacific coast of South America.
